Intervention: Participants who received 6.4 mg/kg of DS-8201a as an intravenous (IV) infusion once every 3 weeks on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle.
Eligibility: Has a pathologically documented unresectable or metastatic breast cancer with HER2 expression (immunohistochemistry [IHC] 3+, IHC 2+, IHC 1+ and/or in situ hybridization [ISH] +) that is refractory to or intolerable with standard treatment, or for which no standard treatment is available
Has a left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF)  50%
Has an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status (ECOG PS) score of 0 or 1
Has a medical history of myocardial infarction within 6 months before enrollment
Has a medical history of ventricular arrhythmias, other than rare occasional premature ventricular contractions
Has uncontrolled or significant cardiovascular disease
Results: Changes in QTcF After Treatment With DS-8201a in Participants With HER2-expressing Metastatic and/or Unresectable Breast Cancer
The number of participants with notable electrocardiogram changes meeting predefined criteria is being reported.
Time frame: Screening (within 7 days before enrollment) up to Cycle 3 Day 15 (each cycle is 21 days)
Arm/Group Description: Participants who received 6.4 mg/kg of DS-8201a as an intravenous (IV) infusion once every 3 weeks on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle.
Unit of Measure: Participants  Maximum change from baseline in QTcF: >30 ms: 3   6.1%
Maximum change from baseline in QTcF: >60 ms: 0   0.0%
